original:
The domestic architecture of the Persian Gulf region, particularly in Bahrain, is distinguished by its unique features and adaptations to the local climate. A prominent element of this architecture is the wind tower, which facilitates natural ventilation within homes. Wind towers are commonly found in older buildings, especially in the historic districts of Manama and Muharraq.

Traditional Bahraini houses typically consist of a series
